Message.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...
Message.Msg: ... What is so difficult to comprehend here? You lost the election, convincingly based on these very issues, and yet your House goes on as though it never happened. The President came up from $250K to $400K. Far less than one percent of the American Public makes $400K. Who do you think you are representing? Americans know who are pulling your strings, and the game is over. Take us over the cliff, and it might be the death knoll for the Republican Party for all time. Enough is enough. CBS News Poll released 7:00 p.m., Dec. 18th, 2012 Views on Two Measures to Reduce the Deficit Raise the tax rate on persons making over $250,000 (Imagine these numbers at 400K) Favor 69% Oppose 29% (Note: even 51% of REPUBLICANS were in favor – over half of them) Reduce Government Programs Favor 45% Oppose 48% Trying to take from the people’s safety nets to help less than 1% who are very wealthy is not…I repeat…NOT, going to happen. Holding the middle class hostage amounts to, in the President’s words, “political suicide.” As I said yesterday…give these folks enough rope…

Topic.Title: Cars versus guns...

Message.Msg: Many that are shot are gangbangers. We can well do without them. Most of the suicides are psychos anyway, again we can do without them. Guns are used to stop crime more often than to commit them. I'll repeat an old refrain. They'll take my gun out of my cold dead hand and I won't go alone.

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: Where are the spending cuts? Obama wants to raise taxes on everyone not just the rich in order to finance his spending spree which will send this country into a death spiral. Most Americans have already seen their annual healthcare costs rise an average of $2500 because of Obamacare and it will rise another $2500 once fully implemented. John Boehner has proposed, in what's being called Plan B, raising taxes without anything in return. Basically what Boehner has done here is adopt a plan put forth by Pelosi this past spring. And the White House has rejected it. This is Boehner explained Plan B because the president won't talk to him. The president won't move on anything. the president wants to go over the fiscal cliff. The Republicans don't want to go over the fiscal cliff. If we go over the fiscal cliff, the Bush tax rates expire for everybody, and everybody's tax rates go up to what they were during the Clinton years. They go up not just for the rich, but for everybody exactly what Obama wants. The country has a lot of low-information voters #$%$. who got Obama elected. To the low-information voters Obama is a cult leader he is whoever they want him to be. They don't know or care about the truth. They are going to discover that their take-home pay is significantly less but will be too stupid to realize it was Obama who caused it.

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: LETTER to the EDITOR-- MINNEAPOLIS STAR TRIBUNE Let's look at what we have learned from this election: Twenty-one of 22 incumbent senators were re-elected, and 353 of 373 incumbent members of the House were re-elected. The American people have re-elected 94 percent of the incumbents who were running for re-election to an institution that has an approval rating of about 9 percent. This indicates, as an electorate, we are a nation of idiots. We're now stuck with the useless, dysfunctional government that we deserve.

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: I guess I don't understand why going over the fiscal cliff is such a bad thing. Help me out here, if we go over the fiscal cliff, won't our taxes go back to where they were when Clinton was president? Didn't we have the highest growth rate in our history during the Clinton years? Didn't we have a surplus during those golden years? And now that we have Obama care and all of the benefits associated with that program, won't the American people be better off? Yes echo you are correct, the president and his party won the election, and since the Republicans are going to be blamed for all of the problems with the economy anyway, it may be time for them to get out of the way, take the blame, and let the president and his party run the show. In your heart you know he is write, The Frogg

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: There are no spending cuts committed to by the Democrats. They want it their way or they won't play. I hear all the talk of compromise, but the Democrats don't even understand the meaning of the word, at least the President doesn't. His 'give backs' are nothing, they are all for show and tools to use so they can blame it all on the Republicans. Obama has refused to own the spending, lack of budgets and terrible economy for the past four years and it apparently looking for a way to blame the next four on someone else. Why? Because he knows it won't get much better, but he will have gotten his way. He wants to remake this country, but what he wants it to become is not what the American people will want or enjoy.

Topic.Title: Cars versus guns...

Message.Msg: Timothy McVeigh didn't use a gun but he killed 168 innocent people including 19 children under the age of six. He injured over 680 innocent people. You can still buy fertilizer, you can still buy racing fuel, and you can still rent box trucks. Murderers will murder with or without a gun. Guns are not the problem; a warped mind is the problem.

Topic.Title: Sandy Hook

Message.Msg: What happens in a 'gun free zone'? No one but the bad guys have any weapons. What happens when they take your guns and someone breaks into your house? He has a gun, you have a hair dryer. I agree that automatic weapons, large capacity clips are unnecessary, the problem is that once a politician gets you leaning one direction, they will knock you over completely. Once they start, they keep saying 'well, we have gone this far, we need to go just a bit further' and they never stop.

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: At this point, it seems to be the best way to go. In this type of recovery you generally don't want that kind of austerity shock, you want to close the deficit gradually. But if we do want to get back to the type of fiscal responsibility of the pre-Republican borrow and spend years we need to start now. And if that means going over the fiscal cliff and then backtracking from it, I'm all for it. Good job only looking at the politics of it though. And yes Cisco, I did get the sarcasm.

Topic.Title: Wake up, Mr. Boehner...the clock's ticking...

Message.Msg: Hey man, I supported the debt ceiling deal in a situation that favored Republicans, and the deals now that strongly favor Democrats. What I don't want is the threat of default and downgrade every time the debt ceiling and/or the Bush tax cuts come up for renewal. And I want a budget. Constant stonewalling and brinksmanship don't suit me. It's not good for business. I want solutions. If that means we go over the fiscal cliff and Republicans can then say they cut taxes while Democrats claim they add spending, I'm all for it. Git-R-Done. But we all know what needs to happen here. The only thing standing in the way is politicking, and mostly the politicking of one side.

Topic.Title: Sandy Hook

Message.Msg: .. “Correct .. just read up on "prohibition…having the alcohol spigots open to the middle class kept the on this a “ – jon the gun runner, who supplied Eliot Ness Jon, following your advice, I spent the entire afternoon reading up on prohibition (read, baking Xmas cookies). I’ve searched high and low on the net…and try as I may, I have not been able to turn up any reference at all to how alcohol “kept the on this a.” Nor could I find any reference at all to “keeping the on this a” ever, anywhere in the history of the world. I don’t even know what “kept the on this a” means. We even polled a small sample of 47 people, and asked them, “Have you ever “kept the on this a”, would you if you could, and have you any clue whatsoever what it means? The results: NO ONE Polled could explain what it means. Although, there were a few abstentions: Of 47 polled: 25 looked bewildered and said, “Are you serious…that’s just gibberish!” 11 told us to FOCK OFF, but Merry Christmas! 6 pulled guns on us and said “if you try to legislate any kind of gun control, I’ll shoot you!” 3 said they weren’t sure what it meant, but they thought they once read it on a Tea Party Sign. 1 said, “ I don’t know, but I’m home schooled and it’s probably a plot from the Department of Education, those #$%$ b#sta*ds!” 1 said, “Man, sounds like you’ve been reading jon the #$%$’s posts!” Jon, as usual, thanks for a meaningful and well thought out post of immense enlightenment. You are a credit to your cause. On this a, you have kept!

Topic.Title: Cars versus guns...

Message.Msg: You can buy fertilizer and racing fuel, but you have to register with Homeland security. You all don't seem to be getting this concept. Not every thing that has resulted in someone dying ever should be regulated in the same way. We have regulations for bomb making ingredients. We have regulations for automobiles. We have regulations for firearms. These regulations do not have to be identical, nor do they have to be a complete ban. Rather, we can tailor regulation to suit each situation. Crazy, eh?

Topic.Title: Barry Targets Old Folks Dividends

Message.Msg: "Most economists are urging the FOMC to stop buying our debt." No they are not. Most economists are busy debating whether the FOMC should have set targets for unemployment/inflation. They are quite confident that the Fed should keep "buying our debt" as you put it. Additionally, about 70% of seniors vote in every presidential election, compared to 60% of the general population. Seniors made up 21% of the 2012 electorate--a new record. For the previous four elections they failed to top 16%. The proportion of seniors in the electorate should continue to rise as the baby boomers get older. More lies from so-called conservatives. Election's over. You can stop now.

Topic.Title: Barry Targets Old Folks Dividends
